content.question_text: A car undergoes a uniform circular motion. The acceleration of the car is

options.text: a non-zero but not a constant

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : a non-zero but not a constant

content.question_text: Rutherford's alpha particle scattering experiment on thin gold foil was responsible for the discovery of

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : atomic nucleus

content.question_text: Magnification is

options.text: actual size of specimen / observed size
observed size of specimen / actual size
actual size of specimen - observed size
actual size of specimen x observed size

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : observed size of specimen / actual size

content.question_text: A 100 W electric bulb is used for 10 hours a day. How many units of energy are consumed in 30 days ?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 30

content.question_text: Rate of evaporation increases with

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : an increase of surface area

content.question_text: If an object is at rest, then the time (X-axis) versus distance (Y-axis) graph

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : is horizontal

content.question_text: If the speed of a moving magnet inside a coil increases, the electric current in the coil

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : increases

content.question_text: The frequency (in Hz) of a note that is one octave higher than 500 Hz is

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 1000

content.question_text: Soap solution used for cleaning purpose appears cloudy. This is due to the fact that  soap micelles can

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : scatter light

content.question_text: People prefer to wear cotton clothes in summer season. This is due to the fact that cotton clothes are

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : good absorbers of water

content.question_text: Two identical solid pieces, one of gold and other of silver, when immersed completely in water exhibit equal weights. When weighed in air (given that density of gold is greater than that of silver)

options.text: the gold piece will weigh more
the silver piece will weigh more
both silver and gold pieces weigh equal
weighing will depend on their masses

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : the silver piece will weigh more

content.question_text: If the wavelengths corresponding to ultraviolet, visible and infrared radiations are given as λ‌ultraviolet ‌, λ‌visible ‌ and λ‌infrared ‌ respectively, then which one of the following gives the correct relationship among these wavelengths?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : λ‌ultraviolet ‌<λ‌visible ‌<λ‌infrared ‌

content.question_text: An electron and a proton starting from rest get accelerated through potential difference of 100 kV. The final speeds of the electron and the proton are Ve and Vp respectively. Which one of the following relations is correct?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Ve > Vp

content.question_text: If two vectors →A and →B are at an angle θ ≠ 0 , then

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : |→A|+|→B| = |→A+→B|

content.question_text: The Hooke's law is valid for

options.text: only proportional region stress-strain curve of the
entire elastic region of the strain curve stress-
elastic as well a s plastic region of the stress-strain curve

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : only proportional region stress-strain curve of the

content.question_text: A particle moves with uniform acceleration along a straight line from rest. The percentage increase in displacement during sixth second compared to that in fifth second is about

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 22%

content.question_text: If two miscible liquids of same volume but different densities P1 and P2 are mixed, then the density of the mixture is given by

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : P1+P22

content.question_text: The position vector of a particle is   →r = 2 t2^x + 3t^y + 4^z   Then the instantaneous velocity v and acceleration a respectively lie

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : on xy-plane and along x-direction

content.question_text: Two persons are holding a rope of negligible mass horizontally. A 20 kg mass is attached to the rope at the midpoint; as a result the rope deviates from the horizontal direction. The tension required to completely straighten the rope is (g=10m/s2)

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 200 N

content.question_text: Which one of the following does not convert electrical energy into light energy?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : A candle

content.question_text: The visible portion of the electromagnetic spectrum is

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : light

content.question_text: When a convex lens produces a real image of an object, the minimum distance between the object and image is equal to

options.text: the focal length of the convex lens
twice the focal length of the convex lens
four times the focal length of the convex lens
one half of the focal length of the convex lens

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : four times the focal length of the convex lens

content.question_text: The direction of magnetic field at any location on the earth’s surface is commonly specified in terms of

options.text: both field declination and field inclination

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : both field declination and field inclination

content.question_text: A circuit has a fuse having a rating of 5 A. What is the maximum number of 100 W-220 V bulbs that can be safely connected in parallel in the circuit?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 11

content.question_text: In which of the following, heat loss is primarily not due to convection?

options.text: Circulation of air around blast furnace
Heating of glass surface of a bulb due to current in filament

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Heating of glass surface of a bulb due to current in filament

content.question_text: Which of the following represents a relation for heat lost = heat gained’?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Principle of calorimetiy

content.question_text: Two metallic wires made from copper have same length but the radius of wire 1 is half of that of wire 2. The resistance of wire 1 is R. If both the wires are joined together in series, the total resistance becomes

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 54R

content.question_text: When the Sun is near the horizon during the morning or evening, it appears reddish. The phenomenon that is responsible for this observation is

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : scattering of light

content.question_text: A wire of copper having length I and area of cross-section A is taken and a current / is flown through it. The power dissipated in the wire is P. If we take an aluminium wire having same dimensions and pass the same current through it, the power dissipated will be

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : > P

content.question_text: The pressure of a fluid varies with depth h as P=P0+ρgh, where ρ is the fluid density. This expression is associated with

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Pascal’s law

content.question_text: Why is argon gas used along with tungsten wire in an electric bulb?

options.text: To increase the life of the bulb
To reduce the consumption of electricity
To make the emitted light colored
To reduce the cost of the bulb

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : To increase the life of the bulb

content.question_text: Which one of the following is the correct relation between the Kelvin temperature (T) and the Celsius temperature (tc)?

options.text: These are two independent temperature scales

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : T=tc+273⋅15

content.question_text: Sound waves cannot travel through a

options.text: wooden hollow pipe placed in vacuum

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : wooden hollow pipe placed in vacuum

content.question_text: Which one of the following is the value of one nanometer?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 10−7 cm

content.question_text: Consider the following statements :1. There is no net moment on a body which is in equilibrium.2. The momentum of a body is always conserved.3. The kinetic energy of an object is always conserved.Which of the statements given above is/are correct?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 1 only

content.question_text: Working of safety fuses depends upon1. magnetic effect of the current2 . chemical effect of the current3. magnitude of the current4. heating effect of the currentSelect the correct answer using the code given below.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 3 and 4 only

content.question_text: An electron and a proton starting from rest are accelerated through a potential difference of 1000 V. Which one of the following statements in this regard is correct?

options.text: The kinetic energy of both the particles will be different.
The speed of the electron will be higher than that of the proton.
The speed of the proton will be higher than that of the electron.
The speed of the electron and the proton will be equal.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : The speed of the electron will be higher than that of the proton.

content.question_text: Two wires are made having same length l and area of cross-section Wire 1 is made of copper and wire 2 is made of aluminium. It is given that the electrical conductivity of copper is more than that of aluminium. In this context, which one of the following statements is correct?

options.text: The resistance of wire 1 will be higher than that of wire 2.
The resistance of wire 2 will be higher than that of wire 1.
The resistance of both the wires will be the same.
If same current is flown through both the wires, the power dissipated in both the wires will be the same.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : The resistance of wire 2 will be higher than that of wire 1.

content.question_text: A ray of light is incident on a plane mirror at an angle of 40° with respect to surface normal. When it gets reflected from the mirror, it undergoes a deviation of

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 40°

content.question_text: Infrared, visible and ultraviolet radiations/ light have different properties. Which one of the following statements related to these radiations/light is not correct?

options.text: The wavelength of infrared is more than that of ultraviolet radiation.
The wavelength of ultraviolet is smaller than that of visible light.
The photon energy of visible light is more than that of infrared light.
The photon energy of ultraviolet is lesser than that of visible light.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : The photon energy of ultraviolet is lesser than that of visible light.

content.question_text: After using for some time, big transformers get heated up. This is due to the fact that 1. current produces heat in the transformers 2. hysteresis loss occurs in the transformers 3. liquid used for cooling gets heated Select the correct answer using the code given below.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 1, 2 and 3

content.question_text: A person is standing on a frictionless horizontal ground. How can he move by a certain distance on this ground?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : By sneezing

content.question_text: Joule-Thomson process is extremely useful and economical for attaining low temperature. The process can be categorized as

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : adiabatic process

content.question_text: Ultrasonic waves are produced by making use of

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : piezoelectric material

content.question_text: A person throws an object on a horizontal frictionless plane surface. It is notice  that there are two forces acting on this object—(i) gravitational pull and (ii) normal reaction of the surface. According to the third law of motion, the net resultant force is zero. Which one of the following can be said for the motion of the object?

options.text: The object will move with acceleration.
The object will move with deceleration.
The object will move with constant speed, but varying direction.
The object will move with constant velocity.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : The object will move with constant velocity.

content.question_text: Consider the following statements : 1. The chain reaction process is used in nuclear bombs to release a vast amount of energy, but in nuclear reactors, there is no chain reaction. 2. In a nuclear reactor, the reaction is controlled, while in nuclear bombs, the reaction is uncontrolled. 3. In a nuclear reactor, all operating reactors are ‘critical’, while there is no question of ‘criticality’ in case of a nuclear bomb. 4. Nuclear reactors do not use moderators, while nuclear bombs use them. Which of the above statements about operational principles of a nuclear reactor and a nuclear bomb is/are correct?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 2 and 3

content.question_text: When a piece of pure silicon is doped with aluminium, then

options.text: the conductivity of the doped silicon piece will remain the same
the doped silicon piece will become n-type
the doped silicon piece will become p-type
the resistivity of the doped silicon piece will increase

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : the doped silicon piece will become p-type

content.question_text: Suppose voltage V is applied across a resistance R. The power dissipated in the resistance is P. Now the same voltage V is applied across a parallel combination of three equal resistors each of resistance R. Then the power dissipated in the second case will be

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 3P

content.question_text: Which one of the following is not a semiconductor?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Quartz

content.question_text: A parallel-plate capacitor, with air in between the plates, has capacitance C.  Now the space between the two plates of the capacitor is filled with a dielectric of dielectric constant 7. Then the value of the capacitance will become

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 7C

content.question_text: For which one of the following does the centre of mass lie outside the body?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : A ring

content.question_text: Consider the electromagnetic radiations having wavelengths 200 nm, 500 nm and 1000 nm. Which wavelength(s) of the following can make visual sensation to a human eye?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 500 nm only

content.question_text: A copper wire of radius r and length I has a resistance of R. A second copper wire with radius 2r and length I is taken and the two wires are joined in a parallel combination. The resultant resistance of the parallel combination of the two wires will be

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : R5

content.question_text: A parallel-plate capacitor of capacitance C1 is made using two gold plates.  Another parallel-plate capacitor of capacitance C2 is made using two aluminium plates with same plate separation, and all the four plates are of same area. If pg and pa are respectively the electrical resistivities of gold and aluminium, then which one of the following relations is correct?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : C1=C2

content.question_text: A photon of X-ray has energy of 1 keV. A photon of visible radiation has energy of 3 eV. In this context, which one of the following statements is not correct?

options.text: The wavelength of X-ray photon is less than the wavelength of visible radiation photon.
Both the photons have different energies.
The speeds of both the photons in vacuum are different.
The frequency of X-ray photon is higher than the frequency of visible radiation photon.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : The speeds of both the photons in vacuum are different.

content.question_text: The optical phenomenon that is primarily responsible for the observation of rainbow on a rainy day is

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : dispersion

content.question_text: Which one of the following statements is not correct?

options.text: The cathode rays originate from cathode and proceed towards the anode in a cathode-ray discharge tube.
The television picture tubes are nothing but cathode-ray tubes.
The cathode rays themselves are not visible.
The characteristics of cathode rays depend upon the nature of the gas present in the cathode-ray tube.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : The characteristics of cathode rays depend upon the nature of the gas present in the cathode-ray tube.

content.question_text: In total internal reflection, the light travels from

options.text: rarer to denser medium and it occurs with no loss of intensity
denser to rarer medium and it occurs with no loss of intensity
rarer to denser medium and it occurs with loss of intensity
denser to rarer medium and it occurs with loss of intensity

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : denser to rarer medium and it occurs with no loss of intensity

content.question_text: The energy of a photon, whose momentum is 10 MeV/ c, where c is the speed of light, is- given by

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 10 MeV

content.question_text: Light travels in a straight line (rectilinear propagation of light). This statement does hold if the medium of travel for light is

options.text: made up of slabs of different refractive indices

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : homogeneous and transparent

content.question_text: The spring constant of a spring depends on its

options.text: thickness, its diameter and its material

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : thickness, its diameter and its material

content.question_text: The pressure exerted by a 760 mm column of mercury at 0 °C is known as

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 1 atmosphere

content.question_text: Which one of the following statements is not correct?

options.text: The response of the ear to sound of increasing intensity is approximately logarithmic.
The sensitivity of the human ear does not vary with the frequency of the sound.
When two or more waves traverse the same medium, the displacement of any element of the medium is the algebraic sum of the displacements due to each wave.
Longitudinal waves can travel in all media—solids, liquids and gases.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : The sensitivity of the human ear does not vary with the frequency of the sound.

content.question_text: In a bipolar junction transistor

options.text: all the three regions (the emitter, the base and the collector) have equal concentrations of impurity
the emitter has the least concen­tration of impurity
the collector has the least concen­tration of impurity
the base has the least concen­tration of impurity

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : the base has the least concen­tration of impurity

content.question_text: The rate of change of momentum of a body is equal to the resultant:

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : force

content.question_text: The SI unit of mechanical power is :

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Watt

content.question_text: Two systems are said to be in thermal equilibrium if and only if:

options.text: there can be a heat flow between them even if they are at different temperatures
there cannot be a heat flow between them even if they are at different temperatures
there is no heat flow between them

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : there is no heat flow between them

content.question_text: Which one of the following statements is correct ? The velocity of sound :

options.text: does not depend upon the nature of media
is maximum in gases and minimum in liquids
is maximum in solids and minimum in liquids
is maximum in solids and minimum in gases

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : is maximum in solids and minimum in gases

content.question_text: Which one of the following statements is not correct?

options.text: Sound waves in gases are longitudinal in nature
Sound waves having frequency below 20 Hz are known as ultrasonic waves
Sound waves having higher amplitudes are louder
Sound waves with high audible frequencies are sharp

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Sound waves having frequency below 20 Hz are known as ultrasonic waves

content.question_text: A myopic person has a power of -1.25 Dioptre. What is the focal length and nature of his lens ?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 80 cm and concave lens

content.question_text: Which one of the following statements about bar magnet is correct ?

options.text: The pole strength of the north-pole of a bar magnet is larger than that of the south-pole
When a piece of bar magnet is bisected perpendicular to its axis, the north and south poles get separated
When a piece of bar magnet is bisected perpendicular to its axis, two new bar magnets are formed
The poles of a bar magnet are unequal in magnitude and opposite in nature

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : When a piece of bar magnet is bisected perpendicular to its axis, two new bar magnets are formed

content.question_text: A person rings a metallic bell near a strong concrete wall. He hears the echo after 0. 3 s. If the sound moves with a speed of 340 m/s, how far is the wall from him?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 51 m

content.question_text: A body is falling freely under the action of gravity alone in vacuum. Which one of the following remains constant during the fall?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Total mechanical energy

content.question_text: X-rays are

options.text: deflected by an electric field but not by a magnetic field
deflected by a magnetic field but not by an electric field
deflected by both a magnetic field and an electric field
not deflected by an electric field or a magnetic field

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : not deflected by an electric field or a magnetic field

content.question_text: The focal length of the lens of a normal human eye is about

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 2.5 cm

content.question_text: Which one of the following physical quantities is the same for molecules of all gases at a given temperature?

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Kinetic energy

content.question_text: Newton’s laws of motion do not hold good for objects

options.text: moving with velocity comparable to velocity of light

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : moving with velocity comparable to velocity of light

content.question_text: Which one of the following statements is not correct?

options.text: Weight of a body is different on different planets.
Mass of a body on the earth, on the moon and in empty space is the same.
Weightlessness of a body occurs when the gravitational forces acting on it are counter-balanced.
Weight and mass of a body are equal at sea level on the surface of the earth.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Weight and mass of a body are equal at sea level on the surface of the earth.

content.question_text: A brick is thrown vertically from an aircraft flying two kilometres above the earth. The brick will fall with a

options.text: constant speed for some time then with constant acceleration as it nears the earth

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : constant acceleration

content.question_text: The outside rear view mirror of modem automobiles is marked with warning “objects in mirror are closer than they appear”. Such mirrors are

options.text: concave mirrors with very large focal lengths
concave mirrors with very small focal lengths

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : convex mirrors

content.question_text: In respect of the difference of the gravitational force from electric and magnetic forces, which one of the following statements is true ?

options.text: Gravitational force is stronger than the other two.
Gravitational force is attractive only, whereas the electric and the magnetic forces are attractive as well as repulsive.
Gravitational force has a very short range.
Gravitational force is a long range force, while the other two are short range forces.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Gravitational force is attractive only, whereas the electric and the magnetic forces are attractive as well as repulsive.

content.question_text: Creation of something from nothing is against the law of

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Conservation of mass-energy

content.question_text: An electron and a proton are circulating with same speed in circular paths of equal radius.  Which one among the following will happen, if the mass of a proton is about 2,000 times that of an electron ?

options.text: The centripetal force required by the electron is about 2,000 times more than that required by the proton
The centripetal force required by the proton is about 2,000 times more than that required by the electron
No centripetal force is required for any charged particle
Equal centripetal force acts on both the particles as they rotate in the same circular path

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : The centripetal force required by the proton is about 2,000 times more than that required by the electron

content.question_text: An object is raised to a height of 3 m from the ground. It is then allowed to fall on to a table 1 m high from ground level. In this context, which one among the following statements is correct ?

options.text: Its potential energy decreases by two-thirds its original value of total energy.
Its potential energy decreases by one-third its original value of total energy.
Its kinetic energy increases by two-thirds, while potential energy increases by one-third.
Its kinetic energy increases by one-third, while potential energy decreases by one-third.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Its potential energy decreases by two-thirds its original value of total energy.

content.question_text: Two pieces of conductor of same material and of equal length are connected in series with a cell. One of the two pieces has cross-sectional area double that of the other. Which one of the following statements is correct in this regard ?

options.text: The thicker one will allow stronger current to pass through it.
The thinner one would allow stronger current to pass through it.
Same amount of electric current would pass through both the pieces producing more heat in the thicker one.
Same amount of electric current would pass through both the pieces producing more heat in the thinner one.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Same amount of electric current would pass through both the pieces producing more heat in the thinner one.

content.question_text: The horizontal wind circulation near the Earth’s surface is due to the1. pressure gradient.2. frictional force.3. coriolis force.Select the correct answer using the code given below :

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 1, 2 and 3

content.question_text: A wire-bound standard resistor uses manganin or constantan. It is because

options.text: these alloys are cheap and available
they have resistivity which almost remains unchanged with temperature

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : they have resistivity which almost remains unchanged with temperature

content.question_text: Statement I :When a gun is fired it recoils, i.e., it pushes back, with much less velocity than the velocity of the bullet.Statement II :Velocity of the recoiling gun is less because the gun is much heavier than the bullet.

options.text: Both the statements are individually true and Statement II is the correct explanation of Statement I.
Both the statements are individually true, but Statement II is not the correct explanation of Statement I.
Statement I is true, but Statement II is false.
Statement I is false, but statement II is true.

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Both the statements are individually true, but Statement II is not the correct explanation of Statement I.

content.question_text: In an observation, α-particles, β-particles and γ-rays have same energies. Their penetrating power in a given medium in increasing order will be

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : α,β,γ

content.question_text: A person standing 1 m in front of a plane mirror approaches the mirror by 40 cm. The new distance between the person and his image in the plane mirror is

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : 1.2 m

content.question_text: Electricity is produced through dry cell from

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : chemical energy

content.question_text: The upper and lower portions in common type of bi-focal lenses are respectively

options.text: both concave of different focal lengths
both convex of different focal lengths

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : concave and convex

content.question_text: Tungsten is used for the construction of filament in electric bulb because of its

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : high melting point

content.question_text: Inactive Nitrogen and Argon gases are usually used in electric bulbs in order to

options.text: increase the intensity of light emitted
increase the life of the filament
make the production of bulb economical

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : increase the life of the filament

content.question_text: In the phenomenon of dispersion of light, the light wave of shortest wavelength is

options.text: slowed down and refracted the most
slowed down and refracted the least

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : slowed down and refracted the most

content.question_text: An oscilloscope is an instrument which allows us to see waves produced by

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : sound

content.question_text: The distance-time graph for an object is shown above. Which one of the following statements holds true for this object ?

options.text: The object is moving with uniform , speed
The object is having non-linear motion
The object is moving with non- uniform speed

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : The object is at rest

content.question_text: For a harmonic oscillator, the graph between momentum p and displacement q would come out as

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : an ellipse

content.question_text: The position, relative size and nature of the image formed by a concave lens for an object placed at infinity are respectively

options.text: between focus and optical centre, diminished and virtual
between focus and optical centre, magnified and real

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : at focus, diminished and virtual

content.question_text: No matter how far you stand from a mirror, your image appears erect. The mirror is likely to be

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : either plane or convex

content.question_text: A mobile phone charger is

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : a step-down transformer

content.question_text: Two layers of a cloth of equal thickness provide warmer covering than a single layer of cloth with double the thickness. Why?

options.text: Because of the air encapsulated between two layers
Since effective thickness of two layers is more
Fabric of the cloth plays the role
Weaving of the cloth plays the  role

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Because of the air encapsulated between two layers

content.question_text: In cricket match, while catching a fast-moving ball, a fielder in the ground gradually pulls his hands backwards with the moving ball to reduce the velocity to zero. The act represents

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : Newton’s second law of motion

content.question_text: When an incandescent electric bulb glows

options.text: the electric energy is completely converted into light energy
he electric energy is partly converted into light energy and partly into heat energy
the light energy is converted into electric energy
the electric energy is converted into magnetic energy

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : he electric energy is partly converted into light energy and partly into heat energy

content.question_text: You are asked to jog in a circular track of radius 35 metres. Right at one complete round on the circular track, your displacement and the distance covered by you are respectively

solution.explanation: Correct Answer is : zero and 220 metres
